VECTORS
```{r}
number_apple<-c(3,4,7,5,1)
number_banana<-c(2,3,1,9,16)
number_fruit<-c(number_banana,number_apple)
number_fruit
length(number_fruit)

#you can do calculations with these vectors since they are numeric
number_apple_2<-number_apple*2
number_banana_3<-number_banana*3
fruit_rate<-number_apple/number_banana #if we want express numbers of apple as a proportion of bananas
number_apple[c(1,2)]<-c(1,8) #replacing the values
number_apple  
```

seq(), a vector composed of increasing or decreasing values
```{r}
year<-seq(from=1860,to=1960,by=10)
year<-seq(from=1980,to=1900,by=-10)
year
```

names()
```{r}
names(year)<-c('Peach','Banana','Apple','Pineapple','Orange','Cherry','Grape','Plum','Pear')
year
#or
fruits_produced<-c('Peach','Banana','Apple','Pineapple','Orange','Cherry','Grape','Plum','Pear')
names(year)<-fruits_produced
year
```

CREATING YOUR OWN FUNCTION
```{r}
my_function<-function(x){   #first input
  s.out<-sum(x)
  l.out<-length(x)
  m.out<-s.out/l.out
  out<-c(s.out,l.out,m.out)  #this is the output
  names(out)<-c('Sum','Length','Mean')
  return(out)  #ending our function by calling the output
}

a<-1:100 #1'den 100'e kadar deÄŸerler
my_function(a)
my_function(number_apple)
```
